abstract: Barclays decided Wednesday to sell $12.3 billion of illiquid assets to a fund set up by former Barclays executives, part of an effort by the British bank to reduce its vulnerability to the ups and downs of credit markets.
snippet: Barclays decided Wednesday to sell $12.3 billion of illiquid assets to a fund set up by former Barclays executives, part of an effort by the British bank to reduce its vulnerability to the ups and downs of credit markets.
lead_paragraph: Barclays decided on Wednesday to sell $12.3 billion of illiquid assets to a fund set up by former Barclays executives, part of an effort by the British bank to reduce its vulnerability to the ups and downs of credit markets, The New York Times’s Julia Werdigier reports from London.

headline.main: Barclays to Sell $12.3 Billion in Illiquid Assets
